channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: @davewiner Hemingway reported the same method as a writer. If memory serves me, he believed the back of the brain keeps musing fruitfully about the chosen thing until morning as the conscious mind muddles with its mundane tasks, and writing in the morning goes full steam ahead. Seems right.
@kjavadizadeh It feels like he gained access to some of the surfaces in Donald Justice’s poems, but not to the layers beneath.

Pericles described the values citizens needed to practice to support Athenian democracy. By ending the draft years ago, American politicians subverted pretty much all of that here in order to protect their jobs and leave them free to start wars. https://t.co/9u4wRh1RrN

"Street food is a stubborn and courageous daily response to the strengths of imported food and wealthy international corporations." Even when translated from Hebrew by machine, I admire the thought and writing in Nimrod Luz's article about street food in the city of Tiberias.
Luz, Nimrod. “Street Food in Tiberias.” Eretz Hakinneret, 2021.

Dissonance (if you are interested) leads to discovery William Carlos Williams, from Patterson. Via Paul @Holdengraber. https://t.co/gouV2oMNnI
Toute valeur n’entraîne pas la révolte, mais tout mouvement de révolte invoque tacitement une valeur. —Camus
(Not every value leads to revolt, but every movement of revolt tacitly invokes a value.)
Via @C_litteraire. https://t.co/5OGwTrjc0C

"Mathematicians know what mathematics is but have difficulty saying it." https://t.co/Y0hImIPKA9
"A² + B² = C² was true before Pythagoras had his name attached to it, and will be true when the sun goes out and no one is left to think of it. It is true for any alien life that might think of it, and true whether they think of it or not."

This is the sort of academic writing that could usefully be followed by an advisory op-ed written for a general audience and distilling the practical implications for a community. Hope so... https://t.co/nsdGAmLnHX
"Wisdom, strength, and even grace come from allowing ourselves to veer into new territory, reflecting on what we learn along the way." https://t.co/OEe7Qh89lD
"A failson is (a derogatory term for) an incompetent scion of a wealthy family." https://t.co/Cn4LgC30s9
"That pause, that moment, that clear difference in the range of human possibilities afforded to Jackson and Kavanaugh—that’s racism, folks. That’s sexism." https://t.co/m5f9fdahzs

William Stafford on daily writing. https://t.co/DCZrN0U0xw https://t.co/Rcy0kY1knj
Kim Stafford describes the daily writing practice of his father, the poet William Stafford, based on the patterns visible in hundreds of pages of daily writing.
https://t.co/YP8oND3F57
@mlidinsk @toebean_peets No pressure…
Thucydides depicts Pericles describing the far-reaching civic values of Athens. https://t.co/2MaYvpOhcS https://t.co/O82skokXL0 https://t.co/o997LcK3Ja https://t.co/oXtLx0eDCD

‘Art should provide people with emotions they have never experienced before, ones they’ve never felt. It’s not about making people cry, but rather that the tear should fall in a certain way, when one least expects it, and for reasons he doesn’t understand.’ —Raúl Ruiz
‘Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint.’ Attributed to Mark Twain.

@davewiner A jazz musician says, Let's see where we two can take this tune by heading north-northeast. In time, the second musician replies, Very interesting locale we've come to, now let's try a little further south.
Outwintering cattle in the northwest of England. Comments by @HerdyShepherd1 James Rebanks and others. https://t.co/tCvP8sPVJu
Consider the endless circus of white people and white men she has been facing. https://t.co/RwVLXF6OFV
No, says Instagram, we’re going to be a video site now. Sorry, small business owners . . . https://t.co/eZRCz4plEm
What does media concentration do to a country? Today, Tuesday, 7:30 pm London time, a live stream discussion of a good question. https://t.co/nhnh3wzGqx https://t.co/jyf6eFOjOf
Home, Sweet Home. https://t.co/h2E9KvCbMq

“That coffee has a great aroma, it’s all through my truck. I’m going to order some,” the letter carrier said, pointing to the shipping bag now in my hand. He didn’t know that @HelioRoast had roasted the beans to our specs just a couple of days before. https://t.co/Uc5HRuZkHg
“That’s how they taught us…” From “Not To Read” by Alejandro Zambra. https://t.co/sv3Ro9beh3
A fun question to ask bookstore customers and employees for short videos. https://t.co/zd5ad50NWT
Heading to the art show on Saturday. https://t.co/Ulbqlsh2iz
